oai_dc:dc.dc:title: CONVERGING SPHERICAL AND CYLINDRICAL SHOCK-WAVES
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: RAMU, A
RAO, MPR
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The self-similar solutions for converging spherical and cylindrical strong shock waves in a non-ideal gas satisfying the equation of state of the Mie-Gruneisen type are investigated. The equations governing the flow, which are highly non-linear hyperbolic partial differential equations, are first reduced to a Poincare-type ordinary differential equation with suitable approximation. Such an approximation helps in obtaining the self-similar solutions and the similarity exponent numerically by phase-plane analysis.
